questions.question: Which of the following statements is true for DFA and NFA?

answers.a: DFA can have epsilon transitions, NFA cannot
answers.b: Every NFA has an equivalent DFA
answers.c: NFA is more powerful than DFA
answers.d: DFA is more powerful than NFA

questions.question: In a DFA, for each state, there are:

answers.b: Exactly one transition for each symbol in the alphabet
answers.c: Multiple transitions for the same symbol

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid property of DFA?

answers.a: It has a single initial state
answers.b: It can have multiple final states
answers.d: Every transition is uniquely determined by a symbol

questions.question: What is the time complexity of simulating a string of length 'n' on a DFA?
Which of the following best describes the relationship between regular expressions, DFAs, and NFAs?

answers.a: Regular expressions are more powerful than DFAs
answers.b: DFAs are more powerful than NFAs
answers.c: Regular expressions, DFAs, and NFAs are equivalent in power
answers.d: DFAs are equivalent to context-free grammars

questions.question: Which of the following is true about epsilon transitions in NFA?

answers.a: They allow the NFA to change state without reading any input symbol
answers.b: They are used to decrease the number of states in DFA
answers.c: They make NFA more powerful than DFA
answers.d: They are not allowed in NFA

questions.question: Which of these operations can be efficiently performed by constructing a DFA for the language?
A language is said to be regular if it can be recognized by a:
Given two states p and q in a DFA, which of the following conditions implies they are equivalent?

answers.a: p and q are both initial states
answers.b: p and q are final states
answers.c: For every input string, p and q transition to the same states
answers.d: There is a path from p to q and vice versa

questions.question: What is the main difference between a DFA and an NFA?

answers.a: DFA has a unique transition for each input symbol in a given state, while NFA may have multiple transitions
answers.b: NFA requires more states than DFA
answers.c: DFA is used for non-regular languages, while NFA is used for regular languages
answers.d: DFA can simulate a Turing Machine
